description: From French agoniser, from Late Latin agonizare, from Ancient Greek ἀγωνίζομαι (agōnízomai, “to fight, contend”). See agony.

verbs.description: agonize (third-person singular simple present agonizes, present participle agonizing, simple past and past participle agonized)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To writhe with agony; to suffer violent anguish.
(intransitive) To struggle; to wrestle; to strive desperately, whether mentally or physically.
(transitive) To cause agony or anguish in someone.
